intro: Leria media, commonly known as the common leria, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly rough texture. Leria media is often found in meadows and along woodland edges, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
